26 ParticleFilter::ParticleFilter(struct PFinitData& data)
27  : nParticles_(data.nParticles), nTargets_(data.nTargets),
28  nStatesPerRobot_(data.statesPerRobot), nRobots_(data.nRobots),
29  nSubParticleSets_(data.nTargets * STATES_PER_TARGET +
30  data.nRobots * data.statesPerRobot + 1),
31  nLandmarks_(data.nLandmarks), alpha_(data.alpha),
32  robotsUsed_(data.robotsUsed), landmarksMap_(data.landmarksMap),
33  iteration_oss(new std::ostringstream("")),
34  particles_(nSubParticleSets_, subparticles_t(data.nParticles)),
35  seed_(time(0)), initialized_(false),
36  bufLandmarkObservations_(
37  data.nRobots, std::vector<LandmarkObservation>(data.nLandmarks)),
38  bufTargetObservations_(data.nRobots), prevTime_(ros::Time::now()),
39  newTime_(ros::Time::now()), iterationTime_(ITERATION_TIME_DEFAULT),
40  weightComponents_(data.nRobots, subparticles_t(data.nParticles, 0.0)),
41  state_(data.statesPerRobot, data.nRobots, data.robotsUsed)
42 {
43 
44  ROS_INFO("Created particle filter with dimensions %d, %d",
45  (int)particles_.size(), (int)particles_[0].size());
46 }
47 
48 void ParticleFilter::predictTarget(uint robotNumber)
49 {
50  if (!initialized_)
51  return;
52 
53  state_.targetPredicted = true;
54 
55  *iteration_oss << "predictTarget(OMNI" << robotNumber + 1 << ") -> ";
56 
57  using namespace boost::random;
58 
59  ROS_DEBUG("OMNI%d is predicting the target state.", robotNumber + 1);
60 
61  // Random acceleration model
62  normal_distribution<> targetAcceleration(TARGET_RAND_MEAN,
63  TARGET_RAND_STDDEV);
64 
65  // If the iterationTime is too high, consider the default value
66  if (iterationTime_ > ITERATION_TIME_MAX)
67  iterationTime_ = ITERATION_TIME_DEFAULT;
68 
69  for (int p = 0; p < nParticles_; p++)
70  {
71  // Get random accelerations
72  pdata_t accel[STATES_PER_TARGET] = { targetAcceleration(seed_),
73  targetAcceleration(seed_),
74  targetAcceleration(seed_) };
75 
76  for (uint s = 0; s < STATES_PER_TARGET; ++s)
77  {
78  pdata_t diff = state_.target.vel[s] * iterationTime_ +
79  0.5 * accel[s] * pow(iterationTime_, 2);
80 
81  particles_[O_TARGET + s][p] += diff;
82 
83  ROS_DEBUG_COND(p == 0, "Target[%d] predicted as %fm after iterationTime "
84  "= %fs and velocity %fm/s",
85  s, diff, iterationTime_, state_.target.vel[s]);
86  }
87  }
88 }
89 
90 void ParticleFilter::fuseRobots()
91 {
92  if (!initialized_ || state_.robotsFused)
93  return;
94 
95  *iteration_oss << "fuseRobots() -> ";
96 
97  ROS_DEBUG("Fusing Robots");
98 
99  state_.robotsFused = true;
100 
101 #ifndef DONT_FUSE_LANDMARKS
102  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
103  {
104  std::vector<pdata_t> probabilities(nRobots_, 1.0);
105  std::vector<uint> landmarksUsed(nRobots_, 0);
106 
107  for (uint l = 0; l < nLandmarks_; ++l)
108  {
109  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
110  {
111  if (false == robotsUsed_[r] ||
112  false == bufLandmarkObservations_[r][l].found)
113  continue;
114 
115  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
116 
117  LandmarkObservation& m = bufLandmarkObservations_[r][l];
118 
119  // Observation in robot frame
120  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 2, 1> Zrobot(m.x, m.y);
121 
122  // Robot pose <=> frame
123  Eigen::Rotation2D<pdata_t> Rrobot(-particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][p]);
124  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 2, 1> Srobot(particles_[o_robot + O_X][p],
125  particles_[o_robot + O_Y][p]);
126 
127  // Landmark in global frame
128  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 2, 1> LMglobal(landmarksMap_[l].x,
129  landmarksMap_[l].y);
130 
131  // Landmark to robot frame
132  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 2, 1> LMrobot = Rrobot * (LMglobal - Srobot);
133 
134  // Error in observation
135  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 2, 1> Zerr = LMrobot - Zrobot;
136 
137  // The values of interest to the particle weights
138  // Note: using Eigen wasn't of particular interest here since it does
139  // not allow for transposing a non-dynamic matrix
140  float expArg = -0.5 * (Zerr(O_X) * Zerr(O_X) / m.covXX +
141  Zerr(O_Y) * Zerr(O_Y) / m.covYY);
142  float detValue = 1.0; // pow((2 * M_PI * m.covXX * m.covYY), -0.5);
143 
144  ROS_DEBUG_COND(
145  p == 0,
146  "OMNI%d's particle 0 is at {%f;%f;%f}, sees landmark %d with "
147  "certainty %f%%, and error {%f;%f}",
148  r + 1, particles_[o_robot + O_X][p], particles_[o_robot + O_Y][p],
149  particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][p], l, 100 * (detValue * exp(expArg)),
150  Zerr(0), Zerr(1));
151 
152  probabilities[r] *= detValue * exp(expArg);
153  landmarksUsed[r]++;
154  }
155  }
156 
157  // Update mean error vector
158  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
159  {
160  if (false == robotsUsed_[r])
161  continue;
162 
163  if (landmarksUsed[r] > 0)
164  weightComponents_[r][p] = probabilities[r];
165  else
166  ROS_WARN("No landmarks used in this timestep for OMNI%d", r + 1);
167  }
168  }
169 #endif
170 
171  // Reset weights, later will be multiplied by weightComponents of each robot
172  resetWeights(1.0);
173 
174  // Duplicate particles
175  particles_t dupParticles(particles_);
176 
177  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
178  {
179  if (false == robotsUsed_[r])
180  continue;
181 
182  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
183 
184  // Create a vector of indexes according to a descending order of the weights
185  // components of robot r
186  std::vector<uint> sorted = order_index<pdata_t>(weightComponents_[r], DESC);
187 
188  // For every particle
189  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
190  {
191  // Re-order the particle subsets of this robot
192  uint sort_index = sorted[p];
193 
194  // Copy this subparticle set from dupParticles' sort_index particle
195  copyParticle(particles_, dupParticles, p, sort_index, o_robot,
196  o_robot + nStatesPerRobot_ - 1);
197 
198  // Update the particle weight (will get multiplied nRobots times and get a
199  // lower value)
200  particles_[O_WEIGHT][p] *= weightComponents_[r][sort_index];
201  }
202  }
203 
204  // If the target measurements were performed prior to this function ending,
205  // then we should call the target fusion step here
206  if (!state_.targetFused && state_.allTargetMeasurementsDone())
207  fuseTarget();
208 }
209 
210 void ParticleFilter::fuseTarget()
211 {
212  if (!initialized_ || state_.targetFused)
213  return;
214 
215  *iteration_oss << "fuseTarget() -> ";
216 
217  ROS_DEBUG("Fusing Target");
218 
219  state_.targetFused = true;
220 
221 #ifndef DONT_FUSE_TARGET
222  // If ball not seen by any robot, just skip all of this
223  bool ballSeen = false;
224  for (std::vector<TargetObservation>::iterator it =
225  bufTargetObservations_.begin();
226  it != bufTargetObservations_.end(); ++it)
227  if (it->found)
228  {
229  ballSeen = true;
230  break;
231  }
232 
233  // resample and exit if ball not seen by any robot
234  if (!ballSeen)
235  {
236  *iteration_oss << "Ball not seen ";
237  return resample();
238  }
239 
240  // If program is here, at least one robot saw the ball
241 
242  // For every particle m in the particle set [1:M]
243  for (uint m = 0; m < nParticles_; ++m)
244  {
245  // Keep track of the maximum contributed weight and that particle's index
246  pdata_t maxTargetSubParticleWeight = 0.0;
247  uint mStar = 0;
248 
249  // Find the particle m* in the set [m:M] for which the weight contribution
250  // by the target subparticle to the full weight is maximum
251  for (uint p = m; p < nParticles_; ++p)
252  {
253  std::vector<pdata_t> probabilities(nRobots_, 0.0);
254 
255  // Observations of the target by all robots
256  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
257  {
258  if (false == robotsUsed_[r] || false == bufTargetObservations_[r].found)
259  continue;
260 
261  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
262 
263  TargetObservation& obs = bufTargetObservations_[r];
264 
265 #ifdef ALTERNATIVE_TARGET_FUSE
266  float Z[3], Zcap[3], Q[3][3], Q_inv[3][3], Z_Zcap[3];
267  Z[0] = obs.x;
268  Z[1] = obs.y;
269  Z[2] = obs.z;
270  Zcap[0] =
271  (particles_[O_TARGET + O_TX][p] - particles_[o_robot + O_X][m]) *
272  (cos(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][m])) +
273  (particles_[O_TARGET + O_TY][p] - particles_[o_robot + O_Y][m]) *
274  (sin(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][m]));
275  Zcap[1] =
276  -(particles_[O_TARGET + O_TX][p] - particles_[o_robot + O_X][m]) *
277  (sin(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][m])) +
278  (particles_[O_TARGET + O_TY][p] - particles_[o_robot + O_Y][m]) *
279  (cos(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][m]));
280  Zcap[2] = particles_[O_TARGET + O_TZ][p];
281  Z_Zcap[0] = Z[0] - Zcap[0];
282  Z_Zcap[1] = Z[1] - Zcap[1];
283  Z_Zcap[2] = Z[2] - Zcap[2];
284 
285  float expArg = -0.5 * (Z_Zcap[0] * Z_Zcap[0] / obs.covXX +
286  Z_Zcap[1] * Z_Zcap[1] / obs.covYY +
287  Z_Zcap[2] * Z_Zcap[2] * 10.0);
288  float detValue = 1.0; // powf( (2*PI*Q[0][0]*Q[1][1]*Q[2][2]),-0.5);
289 
290 #else
291  // Observation in robot frame
292  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 3, 1> Zrobot(obs.x, obs.y, obs.z);
293 
294  // Robot pose <=> frame
295  // Affine creates a (Dim+1) * (Dim+1) matrix and sets
296  // last row to [0 0 ... 1]
297  Eigen::Transform<pdata_t, 2, Eigen::Affine> Rrobot(
298  Eigen::Rotation2D<pdata_t>(-particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][m]));
299  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 3, 1> Srobot(particles_[o_robot + O_X][m],
300  particles_[o_robot + O_Y][m], 0.0);
301 
302  // Target in global frame
303  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 3, 1> Tglobal(particles_[O_TARGET + O_TX][p],
304  particles_[O_TARGET + O_TY][p],
305  particles_[O_TARGET + O_TZ][p]);
306 
307  // Target to local frame
308  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 3, 1> Trobot = Rrobot * (Tglobal - Srobot);
309 
310  // Error in observation
311  Eigen::Matrix<pdata_t, 3, 1> Zerr = Trobot - Zrobot;
312 
313  // The values of interest to the particle weights
314  // Note: using Eigen wasn't of particular interest here since it does
315  // not allow for transposing a non-dynamic matrix
316 
317  // Q - diagonal matrix where the diagonal is ( covXX, covYY, 0.1 )
318  // Qinv - inverse of the diagonal matrix, consists of inverting each
319  // value in the diagonal
320 
321  float expArg =
322  -0.5 * (Zerr[0] * Zerr[0] / obs.covXX +
323  Zerr[1] * Zerr[1] / obs.covYY + Zerr[2] * Zerr[2] / 0.1);
324 
325  float detValue =
326  1.0; // pow((2 * M_PI * obs.covXX * obs.covYY * 0.1), -0.5);
327 #endif
328  probabilities[r] = detValue * exp(expArg);
329  }
330 
331  // Calculate total weight contributed by this particle
332  pdata_t totalWeight =
333  std::accumulate(probabilities.begin(), probabilities.end(), 0.0);
334 
335  // If the weight is the maximum as of now, update the maximum and set
336  // particle p as mStar
337  if (totalWeight > maxTargetSubParticleWeight)
338  {
339  // Swap particle m with m* so that the most relevant (in terms of
340  // weight)
341  // target subparticle is at the lowest indexes
342  maxTargetSubParticleWeight = totalWeight;
343  mStar = p;
344  }
345  }
346 
347  // Particle m* has been found, let's swap the subparticles
348  for (uint i = 0; i < STATES_PER_TARGET; ++i)
349  std::swap(particles_[O_TARGET + i][m], particles_[O_TARGET + i][mStar]);
350 
351  // Update the weight of this particle
352  particles_[O_WEIGHT][m] *= maxTargetSubParticleWeight;
353  }
354 
355 // The target subparticles are now reordered according to their weight
356 // contribution
357 #endif
358 
359  printWeights("After fuseTarget()");
360 
361  // Start resampling
362  resample();
363 }
364 
365 void ParticleFilter::modifiedMultinomialResampler(uint startAt)
366 {
367  // Implementing a very basic resampler... a particle gets selected
368  // proportional to its weight and startAt% of the top particles are kept
369 
370  particles_t duplicate(particles_);
371 
372  std::vector<pdata_t> cumulativeWeights(nParticles_);
373  cumulativeWeights[0] = duplicate[O_WEIGHT][0];
374 
375  for (int par = 1; par < nParticles_; par++)
376  {
377  cumulativeWeights[par] =
378  cumulativeWeights[par - 1] + duplicate[O_WEIGHT][par];
379  }
380 
381  int halfParticles = nParticles_ * startAt;
382 
383  // Resample the rest of the set
384  for (int par = halfParticles; par < nParticles_; par++)
385  {
386  boost::random::uniform_real_distribution<> dist(0, 1);
387  float randNo = dist(seed_);
388 
389  int m = 0;
390  while (randNo > cumulativeWeights[m])
391  m++;
392 
393  copyParticle(particles_, duplicate, par, m);
394  }
395 
396  ROS_DEBUG("End of modifiedMultinomialResampler()");
397 }
398 
399 void ParticleFilter::resample()
400 {
401  if (!initialized_ || state_.resampled)
402  return;
403 
404  state_.resampled = true;
405 
406  *iteration_oss << "resample() -> ";
407  ROS_DEBUG("Resampling");
408 
409 #ifndef DONT_RESAMPLE
410  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
411  {
412  if (false == robotsUsed_[r])
413  continue;
414 
415  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
416 
417  pdata_t stdX = pfuclt_aux::calc_stdDev<pdata_t>(particles_[o_robot + O_X]);
418  pdata_t stdY = pfuclt_aux::calc_stdDev<pdata_t>(particles_[o_robot + O_Y]);
419  pdata_t stdTheta =
420  pfuclt_aux::calc_stdDev<pdata_t>(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA]);
421 
422  state_.robots[r].conf = stdX + stdY + stdTheta;
423 
424  ROS_DEBUG("OMNI%d stdX = %f, stdY = %f, stdTheta = %f", r + 1, stdX, stdY,
425  stdTheta);
426  }
427 
428  // Calc. sum of weights
429  pdata_t weightSum = std::accumulate(particles_[O_WEIGHT].begin(),
430  particles_[O_WEIGHT].end(), 0.0);
431 
432  ROS_DEBUG("WeightSum before resampling = %f", weightSum);
433 
434  // printWeights("before resampling: ");
435 
436  if (weightSum < MIN_WEIGHTSUM)
437  {
438  ROS_WARN("Zero weightsum - returning without resampling");
439 
440  // Print iteration and state information
441  *iteration_oss << "FAIL! -> ";
442  }
443 
444  else
445  {
446  // All resamplers use normalized weights
447  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
448  particles_[O_WEIGHT][p] = particles_[O_WEIGHT][p] / weightSum;
449 
450  modifiedMultinomialResampler(RESAMPLE_START_AT);
451 
452  // printWeights("after resampling: ");
453  }
454 #endif
455 
456  // Resampling done, find the current state belief
457  estimate();
458 }
459 
460 void ParticleFilter::estimate()
461 {
462  *iteration_oss << "estimate() -> ";
463 
464  pdata_t weightSum = std::accumulate(particles_[O_WEIGHT].begin(),
465  particles_[O_WEIGHT].end(), 0.0);
466 
467  // ROS_DEBUG("WeightSum when estimating = %f", weightSum);
468 
469  subparticles_t normalizedWeights(particles_[O_WEIGHT]);
470 
471  // Normalize the weights
472  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
473  normalizedWeights[p] = normalizedWeights[p] / weightSum;
474 
475  if (weightSum < MIN_WEIGHTSUM)
476  {
477  // Print iteration and state information
478  *iteration_oss << "DONE without estimating!";
479  ROS_DEBUG("Iteration: %s", iteration_oss->str().c_str());
480 
481  state_.print();
482 
483  // Clear ostringstream
484  iteration_oss->str("");
485  iteration_oss->clear();
486 
487  // Start next iteration
488  return nextIteration();
489  }
490 
491  // For each robot
492  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
493  {
494  // If the robot isn't playing, skip it
495  if (false == robotsUsed_[r])
496  continue;
497 
498  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
499 
500  // A vector of weighted means that will be calculated in the next loop
501  std::vector<double> weightedMeans(nStatesPerRobot_ - 1, 0.0);
502 
503  // For theta we will obtain the mean of circular quantities, by converting
504  // to cartesian coordinates, placing each angle in the unit circle,
505  // averaging these points and finally converting again to polar
506  double weightedMeanThetaCartesian[2] = { 0, 0 };
507 
508  // ..and each particle
509  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
510  {
511  // Accumulate the state proportionally to the particle's normalized weight
512  for (uint g = 0; g < nStatesPerRobot_ - 1; ++g)
513  {
514  weightedMeans[g] += particles_[o_robot + g][p] * normalizedWeights[p];
515  }
516 
517  // Mean of circular quantities for theta
518  weightedMeanThetaCartesian[O_X] +=
519  cos(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][p]) * normalizedWeights[p];
520  weightedMeanThetaCartesian[O_Y] +=
521  sin(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][p]) * normalizedWeights[p];
522  }
523 
524  // Put the angle back in polar coordinates
525  double weightedMeanThetaPolar =
526  atan2(weightedMeanThetaCartesian[O_Y], weightedMeanThetaCartesian[O_X]);
527 
528  // Save in the robot state
529  // Can't use easy copy since one is using double precision
530  state_.robots[r].pose[O_X] = weightedMeans[O_X];
531  state_.robots[r].pose[O_Y] = weightedMeans[O_Y];
532  state_.robots[r].pose[O_THETA] = weightedMeanThetaPolar;
533  }
534 
535  // Target weighted means
536  std::vector<double> targetWeightedMeans(STATES_PER_TARGET, 0.0);
537 
538  // For each particle
539  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
540  {
541  for (uint t = 0; t < STATES_PER_TARGET; ++t)
542  {
543  targetWeightedMeans[t] +=
544  particles_[O_TARGET + t][p] * normalizedWeights[p];
545  }
546  }
547 
548  // Update position
549  // Can't use easy copy since one is using double precision
550  state_.target.pos[O_TX] = targetWeightedMeans[O_TX];
551  state_.target.pos[O_TY] = targetWeightedMeans[O_TY];
552  state_.target.pos[O_TZ] = targetWeightedMeans[O_TZ];
553 
554  // Add to the velocity estimator
555  double timeNow = ros::Time::now().toNSec() * 1e-9;
556  state_.targetVelocityEstimator.insert(timeNow, targetWeightedMeans);
557 
558  // Ball velocity is estimated using linear regression
559  if (state_.targetVelocityEstimator.isReadyToEstimate())
560  {
561  state_.target.vel[O_TX] = state_.targetVelocityEstimator.estimate(O_X);
562  state_.target.vel[O_TY] = state_.targetVelocityEstimator.estimate(O_TY);
563  state_.target.vel[O_TZ] = state_.targetVelocityEstimator.estimate(O_TZ);
564  }
565  else
566  state_.target.vel[O_TX] = state_.target.vel[O_TY] =
567  state_.target.vel[O_TZ] = 0.0;
568 
569  // Print iteration and state information
570  *iteration_oss << "DONE!";
571  ROS_DEBUG("Iteration: %s", iteration_oss->str().c_str());
572 
573  state_.print();
574 
575  // Clear ostringstream
576  iteration_oss->str("");
577  iteration_oss->clear();
578 
579  // Start next iteration
580  nextIteration();
581 }
582 
583 void ParticleFilter::printWeights(std::string pre)
584 {
585  std::ostringstream debug;
586  debug << "Weights " << pre;
587  for (uint i = 0; i < nParticles_; ++i)
588  debug << particles_[O_WEIGHT][i] << " ";
589 
590  ROS_DEBUG("%s", debug.str().c_str());
591 }
592 
593 // TODO set different values for position and orientation, targets, etc
594 // Simple version, use default values - randomize all values between [-10,10]
595 void ParticleFilter::init()
596 {
597  if (initialized_)
598  return;
599 
600  int lvalue = -10;
601  int rvalue = 10;
602 
603  std::vector<double> defRand((nSubParticleSets_ - 1) * 2);
604 
605  for (int i = 0; i < defRand.size(); i += 2)
606  {
607  defRand[i] = lvalue;
608  defRand[i + 1] = rvalue;
609  }
610 
611  std::vector<double> defPos((nRobots_ * 2), 0.0);
612 
613  // Call the custom function with these values
614  init(defRand, defPos);
615 }
616 
617 // Overloaded function when using custom values
618 void ParticleFilter::init(const std::vector<double>& customRandInit,
619  const std::vector<double>& customPosInit)
620 {
621  if (initialized_)
622  return;
623 
624  // Set flag
625  initialized_ = true;
626 
627  ROS_INFO("Initializing particle filter");
628 
629  ROS_WARN_COND(
630  customRandInit.size() != ((nSubParticleSets_ - 1) * 2),
631  "The provided vector for particle initilization does not have the "
632  "correct size (should have %d elements",
633  (nSubParticleSets_ - 1) * 2);
634 
635  // For all subparticle sets except the particle weights
636  for (int i = 0; i < customRandInit.size() / 2; ++i)
637  {
638  ROS_DEBUG("Values for distribution: %.4f %.4f", customRandInit[2 * i],
639  customRandInit[2 * i + 1]);
640 
641  boost::random::uniform_real_distribution<> dist(customRandInit[2 * i],
642  customRandInit[2 * i + 1]);
643 
644  // Sample a value from the uniform distribution for each particle
645  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
646  particles_[i][p] = dist(seed_);
647  }
648 
649  // Particle weights init with same weight (1/nParticles)
650  resetWeights(1.0 / nParticles_);
651 
652  // Reset PF state
653  state_.reset();
654 
655  // Initialize pose with initial belief
656 
657  ROS_WARN_COND(customPosInit.size() != (nRobots_ * 2),
658  "The provided vector for initial state belief does not have "
659  "the correct size");
660 
661  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
662  {
663  pdata_t tmp[] = { customPosInit[2 * r + O_X], customPosInit[2 * r + O_Y],
664  -M_PI };
665  state_.robots[r].pose = std::vector<pdata_t>(tmp, tmp + nStatesPerRobot_);
666  }
667 
668  // State should have the initial belief
669 
670  ROS_INFO("Particle filter initialized");
671 }
672 
673 void ParticleFilter::predict(const uint robotNumber, const Odometry odom)
674 {
675  if (!initialized_)
676  return;
677 
678  // Change predicted state
679  state_.predicted[robotNumber] = true;
680 
681  *iteration_oss << "predict(OMNI" << robotNumber + 1 << ") -> ";
682 
683  using namespace boost::random;
684 
685  // Variables concerning this robot specifically
686  int robot_offset = robotNumber * nStatesPerRobot_;
687  float alpha[4] = { alpha_[robotNumber * 4 + 0], alpha_[robotNumber * 4 + 1],
688  alpha_[robotNumber * 4 + 2], alpha_[robotNumber * 4 + 3] };
689 
690  // Determining the propagation of the robot state through odometry
691  pdata_t deltaRot = atan2(odom.y, odom.x);
692  pdata_t deltaTrans = sqrt(odom.x * odom.x + odom.y * odom.y);
693  pdata_t deltaFinalRot = odom.theta - deltaRot;
694 
695  // Create an error model based on a gaussian distribution
696  normal_distribution<> deltaRotEffective(deltaRot, alpha[0] * fabs(deltaRot) +
697  alpha[1] * deltaTrans);
698 
699  normal_distribution<> deltaTransEffective(
700  deltaTrans,
701  alpha[2] * deltaTrans + alpha[3] * fabs(deltaRot + deltaFinalRot));
702 
703  normal_distribution<> deltaFinalRotEffective(
704  deltaFinalRot, alpha[0] * fabs(deltaFinalRot) + alpha[1] * deltaTrans);
705 
706  for (int i = 0; i < nParticles_; i++)
707  {
708  // Rotate to final position
709  particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i] += deltaRotEffective(seed_);
710 
711  pdata_t sampleTrans = deltaTransEffective(seed_);
712 
713  // Translate to final position
714  particles_[O_X + robot_offset][i] +=
715  sampleTrans * cos(particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i]);
716  particles_[O_Y + robot_offset][i] +=
717  sampleTrans * sin(particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i]);
718 
719  // Rotate to final position and normalize angle
720  particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i] = angles::normalize_angle(
721  particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i] + deltaFinalRotEffective(seed_));
722  }
723 
724  // If all robots have predicted, also predict the target state
725  if (state_.allPredicted() && !state_.targetPredicted)
726  predictTarget(robotNumber);
727 
728  // Start fusing if all robots have done their measurements and predictions
729  if (!state_.robotsFused && state_.allLandmarkMeasurementsDone() &&
730  state_.allPredicted())
731  fuseRobots();
732 }
733 
734 void ParticleFilter::saveAllLandmarkMeasurementsDone(const uint robotNumber)
735 {
736  if (!initialized_)
737  return;
738 
739  *iteration_oss << "allLandmarks(OMNI" << robotNumber + 1 << ") -> ";
740 
741  // Change state
742  state_.landmarkMeasurementsDone[robotNumber] = true;
743 
744  // Start fusing if all robots have done their measurements and predictions
745  if (!state_.robotsFused && state_.allLandmarkMeasurementsDone() &&
746  state_.allPredicted())
747  fuseRobots();
748 }
749 
750 void ParticleFilter::saveAllTargetMeasurementsDone(const uint robotNumber)
751 {
752  if (!initialized_)
753  return;
754 
755  // Change state
756  state_.targetMeasurementsDone[robotNumber] = true;
757 
758  *iteration_oss << "allTargets(OMNI" << robotNumber + 1 << ") -> ";
759 
760  // Start fusing if all robots have done their target measurements and the
761  // robot fusion step has been performed
762  if (!state_.targetFused && state_.robotsFused &&
763  state_.allTargetMeasurementsDone())
764  fuseTarget();
765 }
766 
767 PFPublisher::PFPublisher(struct ParticleFilter::PFinitData& data,
768  struct PublishData publishData)
769  : ParticleFilter(data), pubData(publishData),
770  robotBroadcasters(data.nRobots), particleStdPublishers_(data.nRobots),
771  robotGTPublishers_(data.nRobots), robotEstimatePublishers_(data.nRobots)
772 {
773  // Prepare particle message
774  msg_particles_.particles.resize(nParticles_);
775  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
776  {
777  msg_particles_.particles[p].particle.resize(nSubParticleSets_);
778  }
779 
780  // Subscribe and advertise the republishing of GT data, time synced with the
781  // state publisher
782  GT_sub_ = pubData.nh.subscribe<read_omni_dataset::LRMGTData>(
783  "gtData_4robotExp", 10,
784  boost::bind(&PFPublisher::gtDataCallback, this, _1));
785 
786  syncedGTPublisher_ = pubData.nh.advertise<read_omni_dataset::LRMGTData>(
787  "/gtData_synced_pfuclt_estimate", 1000);
788 
789  // Other publishers
790  robotStatePublisher_ = pubData.nh.advertise<read_omni_dataset::RobotState>(
791  "/pfuclt_omni_poses", 1000);
792  targetStatePublisher_ = pubData.nh.advertise<read_omni_dataset::BallData>(
793  "/pfuclt_orangeBallState", 1000);
794  particlePublisher_ = pubData.nh.advertise<pfuclt_omni_dataset::particles>(
795  "/pfuclt_particles", 10);
796 
797  // Rviz visualization publishers
798  // Target
799  targetEstimatePublisher_ = pubData.nh.advertise<geometry_msgs::PointStamped>(
800  "/target/estimatedPose", 1000);
801  targetGTPublisher_ =
802  pubData.nh.advertise<geometry_msgs::PointStamped>("/target/gtPose", 1000);
803  targetParticlePublisher_ =
804  pubData.nh.advertise<sensor_msgs::PointCloud>("/target/particles", 10);
805 
806  // Robots
807  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
808  {
809  std::ostringstream robotName;
810  robotName << "omni" << r + 1;
811 
812  // particle publisher
813  particleStdPublishers_[r] = pubData.nh.advertise<geometry_msgs::PoseArray>(
814  robotName.str() + "/particles", 1000);
815 
816  // estimated state
817  robotEstimatePublishers_[r] =
818  pubData.nh.advertise<geometry_msgs::PoseStamped>(
819  robotName.str() + "/estimatedPose", 1000);
820 
821  // ground truth publisher
822  robotGTPublishers_[r] = pubData.nh.advertise<geometry_msgs::PointStamped>(
823  robotName.str() + "/gtPose", 1000);
824  }
825 
826  ROS_INFO("It's a publishing particle filter!");
827 }
828 
829 void PFPublisher::publishParticles()
830 {
831  // The eval package would rather have the particles in the format
832  // particle->subparticle instead, so we have to inverse it
833  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
834  {
835  for (uint s = 0; s < nSubParticleSets_; ++s)
836  {
837  msg_particles_.particles[p].particle[s] = particles_[s][p];
838  }
839  }
840 
841  // Send it!
842  particlePublisher_.publish(msg_particles_);
843 
844 #ifdef PUBLISH_PTCLS
845  // Also send as a series of PoseArray messages for each robot
846  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
847  {
848  if (false == state_.robotsUsed[r])
849  continue;
850 
851  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
852  geometry_msgs::PoseArray msgStd_particles;
853  msgStd_particles.header.stamp = ros::Time::now();
854  msgStd_particles.header.frame_id = "world";
855 
856  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
857  {
858  tf2::Quaternion tf2q(tf2::Vector3(0, 0, 1),
859  particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][p]);
860  tf2::Transform tf2t(tf2q, tf2::Vector3(particles_[o_robot + O_X][p],
861  particles_[o_robot + O_Y][p],
862  pubData.robotHeight));
863 
864  geometry_msgs::Pose pose;
865  tf2::toMsg(tf2t, pose);
866  msgStd_particles.poses.insert(msgStd_particles.poses.begin(), pose);
867  }
868 
869  particleStdPublishers_[r].publish(msgStd_particles);
870  }
871 
872  // Send target particles as a pointcloud
873  sensor_msgs::PointCloud target_particles;
874  target_particles.header.stamp = ros::Time::now();
875  target_particles.header.frame_id = "world";
876 
877  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
878  {
879  geometry_msgs::Point32 point;
880  point.x = particles_[O_TARGET + O_TX][p];
881  point.y = particles_[O_TARGET + O_TY][p];
882  point.z = particles_[O_TARGET + O_TZ][p];
883 
884  target_particles.points.insert(target_particles.points.begin(), point);
885  }
886  targetParticlePublisher_.publish(target_particles);
887 
888 #endif
889 }
890 
891 void PFPublisher::publishRobotStates()
892 {
893  // This is pretty much copy and paste
894  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
895  {
896  if (false == state_.robotsUsed[r])
897  continue;
898 
899  std::ostringstream robotName;
900  robotName << "OMNI" << r + 1;
901 
902  ParticleFilter::State::robotState_s& pfState = state_.robots[r];
903  geometry_msgs::Pose& rosState = msg_state_.robotPose[r].pose.pose;
904 
905  // Create from Euler angles
906  tf2::Quaternion tf2q(tf2::Vector3(0, 0, 1), pfState.pose[O_THETA]);
907  tf2::Transform tf2t(tf2q, tf2::Vector3(pfState.pose[O_X], pfState.pose[O_Y],
908  pubData.robotHeight));
909 
910  // Transform to our message type
911  tf2::toMsg(tf2t, rosState);
912 
913 #ifdef BROADCAST_TF_AND_POSES
914  // TF2 broadcast
915  geometry_msgs::TransformStamped estTransf;
916  estTransf.header.stamp = ros::Time::now();
917  estTransf.header.frame_id = "world";
918  estTransf.child_frame_id = robotName.str();
919  estTransf.transform = tf2::toMsg(tf2t);
920  robotBroadcasters[r].sendTransform(estTransf);
921 
922  // Publish as a standard pose msg using the previous TF
923  geometry_msgs::PoseStamped estPose;
924  estPose.header.stamp = estTransf.header.stamp;
925  estPose.header.frame_id = estTransf.child_frame_id;
926  // Pose is everything at 0 as it's the same as the TF
927 
928  robotEstimatePublishers_[r].publish(estPose);
929 #endif
930  }
931 
932  robotStatePublisher_.publish(msg_state_);
933 }
934 
935 void PFPublisher::publishTargetState()
936 {
937  // Our custom message type
938  msg_target_.x = state_.target.pos[O_TX];
939  msg_target_.y = state_.target.pos[O_TY];
940  msg_target_.z = state_.target.pos[O_TZ];
941  targetStatePublisher_.publish(msg_target_);
942 
943 #ifdef BROADCAST_TF_AND_POSES
944  // Publish as a standard pose msg using the previous TF
945  geometry_msgs::PointStamped estPoint;
946  estPoint.header.stamp = ros::Time::now();
947  estPoint.header.frame_id = "world";
948  estPoint.point.x = state_.target.pos[O_TX];
949  estPoint.point.y = state_.target.pos[O_TY];
950  estPoint.point.z = state_.target.pos[O_TZ];
951 
952  targetEstimatePublisher_.publish(estPoint);
953 #endif
954 }
955 
956 void PFPublisher::publishGTData()
957 {
958  // Publish custom format
959  syncedGTPublisher_.publish(msg_GT_);
960 
961  // Publish poses for every robot
962  geometry_msgs::PointStamped gtPoint;
963  gtPoint.header.stamp = ros::Time::now();
964  gtPoint.header.frame_id = "world";
965 
966  if (true == state_.robotsUsed[0])
967  {
968  gtPoint.point = msg_GT_.poseOMNI1.pose.position;
969  robotGTPublishers_[0].publish(gtPoint);
970  }
971 
972  if (true == state_.robotsUsed[2])
973  {
974  gtPoint.point = msg_GT_.poseOMNI3.pose.position;
975  robotGTPublishers_[2].publish(gtPoint);
976  }
977 
978  if (true == state_.robotsUsed[3])
979  {
980  gtPoint.point = msg_GT_.poseOMNI4.pose.position;
981  robotGTPublishers_[3].publish(gtPoint);
982  }
983 
984  if (true == state_.robotsUsed[4])
985  {
986  gtPoint.point = msg_GT_.poseOMNI5.pose.position;
987  robotGTPublishers_[4].publish(gtPoint);
988  }
989 
990  // Publish for the target as well
991  if (msg_GT_.orangeBall3DGTposition.found)
992  {
993  gtPoint.point.x = msg_GT_.orangeBall3DGTposition.x;
994  gtPoint.point.y = msg_GT_.orangeBall3DGTposition.y;
995  gtPoint.point.z = msg_GT_.orangeBall3DGTposition.z;
996  targetGTPublisher_.publish(gtPoint);
997  }
998 }
999 
1000 void PFPublisher::gtDataCallback(
1001  const read_omni_dataset::LRMGTData::ConstPtr& gtMsgReceived)
1002 {
1003  msg_GT_ = *gtMsgReceived;
1004 }
1005 
1006 void PFPublisher::nextIteration()
1007 {
1008  // Time stamps using ros time
1009  msg_state_.header.stamp = msg_GT_.header.stamp = msg_target_.header.stamp =
1010  ros::Time::now();
1011 
1012  // Publish the particles first
1013  publishParticles();
1014 
1015  // Publish robot states
1016  publishRobotStates();
1017 
1018  // Publish target state
1019  publishTargetState();
1020 
1021  // Publish GT data
1022  publishGTData();
1023 
1024  // Call the base class method
1025  ParticleFilter::nextIteration();
1026 }
1027 
1028 // end of namespace pfuclt_ptcls
1029 }
